reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spacious, clean room, close to Space Needle and walking distance to waterfront restaurants. Good service, breakfast, secure parking. Pleasantly surprised and affordable for the area.
reviews.title: Great hotel by Space Needle

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised. The closeness of the monorail was great and we had an excellent view of the space needle. The rooms were large, clean and the staff were very helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel to someone looking for nice accommodations with a good rate.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

likes.disliked: — a little out of the way if you are wanting to stay in the areas with more activity.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is nothing special but it is not bad either.
reviews.title: No frills, not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ideal in terms of getting to the monorail to take you downtown or the space needle.
reviews.title: Slept well in Seattle

reviews.text: The rooms are clean with a great big fridge to store your beers etc in.
reviews.title: what a view!

likes.disliked: — still has a bit of the chain-y look

reviews.text: I almost didnt book based on a couple of the reviews but I decided to chance it and I am glad I did. The hotel is a bit dated on the exterior and the neighborhood is undergoing a bit of much needed regentrification. I never felt unsafe but I can see why those unfamilar with the urban setting may be. While there were some street people about they arent aggressive and there are enough regular folk walking around that I wouldnt hesitate to put my 72 year old mother in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: Surprisingly decent

reviews.text: The location is excellent! Read that again, Excellent. there are hundreds of restaurants all within about a 10-15 minute walk. I absolutely LOVE walking around in a vibrant downtoan urban setting and this area makes me want to trade in my suburban ranch for a loft. I tried the Spitfire on 4th and Bell and the Frontier room on 1st and Blanchard. Spitfire is southwest spicy sandwiches and salads and Frontier is excellent BBQ, not KC but very good smoked meats, ribs and sandwiches. The Space needle is around the corner, get an even numbered room for a view, otheriwise the view is just cityscape.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The room was clean and while a bit bland served it purpose well. The bed was comfy and there was a fridge and micro. The bathroom is on the smallish side but the water pressure was great. The room is completely 'green' with low impact features which I would expect in Seattle.
reviews.title: Be aware!!! Worst hotel ever.

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, that famous northwest hospitality very evident. I would skip the restaurant in the lobby as it seems to be very basic hotel fare and since there are literally hundreds of great options so very close.
reviews.title: Unexpected Excellence
No respect for teenagers
reviews.text: The hotel charges $15 a night for parking and while that is a huge pet peeve of mine I was aware of it going in and it only annoyed me to the point of mentioning it here. Really, tack on $20 to the price of the room and get rid of the charge, its silly.

The location was perfectly convenient, the room was nice sized, clean, and enjoyable. Free high speed internet was a plus. We enjoyed our view of the Space Needle and the Seattle center carousel. Especially convenient was the location going back and forth to Seattle Center, getting downtown, Pike's Place, etc.
reviews.title: Not bad, but not great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hands down our new place to stay in Seattle.
reviews.title: Best kept secret (3rd time staying; still a charm!)

likes.liked: — Tie between the value and the service :p

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Son arrived only to find that they would not rent a room to him. Just because he did not hold a credit card, even though he had permission to use his parents, and we called to verify. We were told this could only be arranged during office hours. It was now late, office hours were over, I would have thought that the manager could make the decision. But he told me NO. They had nowhere else to go. The manager suggested a grungy hotel down the road. They had cash, and our credit card and we even talked to the manager, but he told us he could not make any exceptions, as this would be discrimination. I think that it is discrimination to the teenagers, as they would not rent to them with our approval, written or verbal. I can make purchases online, but somehow I could not even place my credit card as security for the price of the room and other expenses. Some policies are too strict and some exceptions should always be allowed. I spoke to Best Western head office and they told me that all Best Westerns were individually owned and operated, therefore the policy was only with this one hotel. So why couldn't the rule be bent a little? It wasn't alot to ask for. Let the decent kids have a good place to stay, no you treat them like scum and you wonder why our kids are the way they are today. WOW !!!!!!!! So if you decide to stay here, beware of policies.
reviews.title: Perfect location!!

likes.disliked: — You have to pay for parking ($15/night)

reviews.text: I saw one reviewer mention an uptight concierge. I think I know who you mean. I think she was just being civil, clearly should not be desk staff. The other desk staff members were very cordial and would make suggestions when I had a question as to getting to the airport, what to eat, where to go, and so on. The lobby area has a nice fireplace area and tons of travel literature.
reviews.title: Cheap Place to Stay, Great Location, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: When I checked out the breakfast buffet, it was quite ample. I must have come at a bad time because there were no staff on duty and lots of tables were not bussed. Also they were out of coffee. This was not the case the next day, so perhaps a fluke.
reviews.title: an okay standard hotel

likes.liked: — Closeness to the Space Needle monorail, and the great Sports bar
likes.disliked: — 1 unfriendly, no-name badged staff - very thin windows.

reviews.text: The elevator is pretty clunky. The door closes slowly and should be repaired or made to be smoother.
reviews.title: It's a great location

likes.liked: — The polite and helpful staff. Proximity to the Needle. And the Complimentary Breakfast
likes.disliked: — Parking fees. Proximity to a convenience store.

reviews.text: The room was great and eco-friendly. Recycling is encouraged. The bathroom area has lotions, shampoo and conditioner in dispensers rather than little bottles. This is great for the hotel especially from guests who like to rip off bottles. Probably saves money for them, certainly.
reviews.title: Clean, eco-friendly bargain with great staff

likes.liked: — great value with free breakfast and Wi-Fi

reviews.text: I heard mention of homeless. Well, they're in every city, and to criticize the hotel for a city problem is not fair. If you're city smart they usually are not a problem.
reviews.title: Nice Place to stay but bad neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was great for a quick place to go and see sights.
reviews.title: Great location, price, and view

likes.liked: — Location, parking garage, free use of computers in business center and room size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Directly across the street from Space needle, downtown tram,
reviews.title: Stay & Save . . Great Location . . Good Renovations

reviews.text: Science center, and the downtown mall.
reviews.title: Decent Services, Dreadful Smell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amenities:
reviews.title: Would definitely stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great- close to the city center, right by the Expo in Belltown (monorail, Space Needle and EMP). Great view of the Space Needle. And the price is reasonable, including the parking.
reviews.title: Good location & value, but some staffing gaps

reviews.text: The free breakfast buffet was really good, and the attached restaurant & bar is nice.
reviews.title: Deceptive Staff

reviews.text: The night staff was pretty lax, though. While I checked in, the three lobby staff never interrupted a three-way conversation behind the desk about their weekend plans. It's a little thing, but it reflects a certain lack of "professionalism." The night desk also never gave me a promised callback regarding the lack of WiFi in my room, and never passed a message about it to the daytime desk.
reviews.title: Couldn't wait to leave.

likes.liked: — The view of the Space Needle from my window.

reviews.text: The daytime desk staff was much more courteous and responsive, though. They referred me to the WiFi provider directly (who were ultimately still unable to get me online, probably due to a fault with my laptop).
reviews.title: Never Stay Again

reviews.text: As someone else noted in a review, there seems to be no procedure at the hotel for clearing used room service trays from the hallways. There was a discarded tray with meal remnants outside a door on our floor when we checked in that remained there for over 24 hours (the cleaning staff just ignored it the next day, because it was still there the following evening after our room had been cleaned.)
reviews.title: Not impressed unfriendly staff
